summary: The "Caspian Sea," categorized under the natural environment, plays a significant role in EU legal and regulatory frameworks, particularly concerning environmental protection and transboundary water management. As the largest enclosed inland body of water, it is subject to various international agreements aimed at preserving its unique ecosystem and biodiversity. The EU engages with Caspian states to promote sustainable development and mitigate environmental degradation. Regulatory measures may include directives on water quality, habitat conservation, and pollution control, reflecting the EU's commitment to environmental stewardship and international cooperation in managing shared natural resources effectively.
